instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Hi,
i have a mac air with green light , it's taking to much current when battery and charger are plugged in  ?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
I don't exactly understand what you mean...
Please post accurate information.
Do you get image and missing backlight?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: This is a PLZ BRO. Do not PLZ BRO. Have your tried known good parts I/O Board/cable, battery etc?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Mac works normaly on battery but when i plug megsafe charger the board is going hot and charges to much amps .
also pin 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> resistance  is 150 omhs ?? 
fixed backlight bad chip .

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
"pin 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> resistance is 150 omhs"
You mean <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; fix that problem.
Check <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>-52, their traces and solders to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
I hope you talk about resistance between pins, not to ground...

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: Something wrong with pins 17/18. Solve that issue

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: I changed <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> with high omhs , now normal value 2.45 ohms . but it's not turning On . both ppbus , pp3v42 available ! what to check now ?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with charger only?
Also post <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> voltage.
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.59v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> = 3.42v
it turns now ON ! when i unplug the LIO Connector it turns on but when i plug the battery its charge to much amps . but it stays on with battery when unplug charger ?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Very unclear...
Do you really ask if stays on in such case?
Cannot test???
Looks like you have a problem with LIO board, or flex...

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: I tries 3 lio boards and flex cable still the same board looks clean. The problem is only when i plug the battery in and starts charging to much amps .

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: Did you try a new battery???

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: No i dont have another one , but why it turns on only on battery without charger but dont charge ?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
"The problem is only when i plug the battery in and starts charging to much amps
----------------------------
it turns on only on battery without charger but dont charge"
You really mix the things and make hard to understand you.
Don't charge, but take too much ampers charging; very unclear/confuse, as I said...

Please specify:
- does it turn on on charger only?
- does it turn on battery only?
- does it turn on with both charger and battery connected?
And use original Magsafe 2 charger!!!

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
ok Sir, 

- does it turn on on charger only? --- Yes only by SMC bypass !!
- does it turn on battery only? ---- Yes , just by pressing power button or shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> !
- does it turn on with both charger and battery connected? Yes , but the board is getting Hot on both magsafe2 and powerDC !

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
You didn't mention about SMC bypass before; very imporrtant info!

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> on charger only.
Also post <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.
Take a look at <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_DISCRETE_ISENSE</SIGNAL> too.

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Sir,

<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 000.0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> =  3.092v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> = 059.0mv
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> =  038.0mv
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_DISCRETE_ISENSE</SIGNAL> = 164.3mv

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: Board turns on with charger alone when disconnected LIO flex?

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: Yes by smc bypass.

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: I asked if turns on without LIO flex in normal mode...

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message: No sir , nothing

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Post exact resistance between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for reaction (drop pulse) at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is high for sure?

Do NOT start the board in SMC bypass again, need to find the problem.

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Pin 27/28 22.00 
pwrbtn drops to 0000 and back to 3.4v 
batlow is 3.4v 

but what makes me crazy now it starts it self without flex I/O ?!

threads.title: Mac Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light , no backlight , dont charge
threads.message:
Check again with LIO flex connected.
If doesn't start again, try known good LIO flex and board.
Also inspect LIO connector pins on MLB, under microscope.
